titleStmt.title: John Seaton et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To his Excellency
Thos. E. Bramlett
Governor of the Commonwealth of Ky

We the undersigned Citizens of Greenup County would respectfully represent, that one W. B. Johnson was Indicted at the Nove Term of the Greenup Circuit Court ^1863^ for shooting with intent to kill. he was recognised to appear in the Greenup Circuit Court in the Sum of one hundred Dollars with Charles Russell & Alex Maddox as his Securities. The defendant Johnson was tried. & fined $300.- Along Though he was not present at the trial and the recognizance forfeited The petitioners Russell & Maddox are Gentlemen of high standing. but humble in life. lo live by their Daily Labor and are illey able to pay the forfeit. They therefore present their case as one that Demands Executive interposition and Therefore pray that They may be releived of the & penalties of the forfeiture and as in Duty Bound will ever pray &c

John Seaton
J M Robb
William Corum clerk
Greenup Circuit Court
Thos E Myers Asst Assr
J. E Brooks, D S
D J McCoy J G C C
Alexander Patten
Geo. E. Roe
Geo. A. Corum Clerk
Greenup Ct CourtAllen Mcgee of
greenup County
Greenup Cir ct
vs
W B. Johnson
Charles Russell
petition to the
Governor of
Kentucky
refused
